column4: why dont i get the download speeds in linux i get in windows?
??? I get faster dls in 'nix than I ever did in Windows...site error perhaps?
Okay, and where are you seeing slow download speeds at? What sites?

Speeds when dling from repositories are effected by: How many people on at that time (time of day can make a major difference) and the hops for your location. When a major distro is released for example...everyone tries to get it on release day, and all you'll see on the net are complaints about how the latest version ate their operating system, locked up, etc...when in reality, it was horribly slow dl speeds because EVERYONE was

So, if you can be a little more specific, I can help. If you're talking about repositories in Syn, my suggestion would be to go to SETTINGS - REPOSITORIES - UBUNTU SOFTWARE - DOWNLOAD FROM - Select OTHER and then pick a location NEAR YOU. This might speed things up greatly for you.
Checking
Completely different creature. :) But...in a lot of good ways, believe me.
Why are you going through http://gwenole.beauchesne.info for this files?
Here's a better question - what are you trying to get to work that's not working...because I'm wondering if you can't just get these from the advanced repositories.
Okay, just a sec bud...
Probably, but let's see if we can't fix this once and for all... are you following this guide? http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=476924
Yeah, the script will take care of the whole shebang for ya (hopefully)
Use that website for questions you might have in the future...if it's out there, it's probably there...and most of the posters really know what they're talking about. :D
It's scary? Other than that, gimmie a sec to do a check.
Error 17 indicates GRUB can't id the partition type. Check http://www.gnu.org/software/grub/manual/grub.html# Troubleshooting for more info.
Sounds like perhaps there's some issues with the duality of your bootin'.
It might be having an issue with that...hmmm...So, when you go to boot...it gives you a grub error 17 and stops?
Oy....can you boot into either OS or only Ubuntu?
So...when you use the supergrub disc...can you boot either, or is one buggered?
Okay....then there's something different between your supergrub config and your regular grub config that needs to be changed around...
And I'm no expert on how to do that...but I know what NEEDs to be done...
w00t! What'd ya do for the fix?
I had no idea you didn't have the 'nix drive as master.... ><
Glad it got fixed though! :D
